alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 10 at 11:38AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening. Heavy rain is possible, due to slow movement of storms. With ground saturated from rainfall over the past few days, locally very heavy rainfall amounts may produce flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll, Floyd and Grayson. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall amounts over saturated ground may result in flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
